jerusalem.name: Jerusalem
info: Story: Jerusalem is the city of peace, though it rarely had a peaceful moment.  It is where the Temple of Israel was originally built, and represents the dawn, where this is hope for the day.
Calling: Any player can win the game by influencing 3 locations at once
Influence Bonus: 1 gold 2 influence
Special Rules:
Influence cards: If you influence a location, you get a special influence card. Influence cards don't go to your discard at the end of turn, but you automatically draw them if you influence locations
Scrapping Cards: Dragging a card into the scrap pile will remove it from your deck for the rest of the game.  This is helpful when you scrap influence and gold so you can get better cards more often

character.name: Paul
character.quote: For I resolved to know nothing while I was with you except Jesus Christ and him crucified. (1COR2:2)

location.name: Rome
info: Story: Paul is called to be an apostle and lead others to Christ.  In his ministry he works alongside [Barnabas], [Priscilla and Aquila], and [Timothy] writing numerous [Epistles] to the churches they plant, as well as being assaulted and worshipped by [Mob]s on numerous occassions. He is eventually [imprisoned] (multiple times).  While in prison he [Exhorts] the church helping them stay on course, is caught in a [huge storm] and shipwrecked but saved by [Angelic protection]

Theme: Paul's journey is all about following Christ.  He does this by evangalizing, church planting, and finding fellowship. He (and other Christians) are called to go out and make disciples, not just as a number, but in order to fellowship.
Influence Bonus: 2 gold
Calling: Plant 5 churches (read Church Plant)
Bane: Get 6 wounds
Church Plant: If the Paul player plays an apostle on a location and become influencer; Paul plants a church- otherwise Paul gains a wound
Special Rules:
Apostle: Apostles gain +1 INF for each church on a location they are played on (even if the apostle doesn't belong to Paul)
Mob: +1 INF for every other card you already played here
Angelic: If you do not have the most influence on this location, it does not check influence this turn
Imprisonment: AFTER the influence phase, return this and the most expensive card on this location (that does not belong to you) to their original market decks, does not affect starter cards

character.name: Joshua
character.quote: Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go. (Joshua 1:9)

location.name: Canaan
info: Story: Joshua sees the land filled with [milk and honey] and has himself made a [faithful report] of it but other [spies] caused fear in the Israelite camp due to the rumors of giants [nephilim] and [armies as vast as the sand on the sea]- they must choose whether to follow God faithfully as promised on [Mt Gerazim] or recant their covanent with Him and suffer the curses of [Mt Ebal]

Theme: Joshua's story is a story of relying on faith to overcome the fear of the world.  Fear is a powerful weapon against the proud and those with power, but those who rely on faith do not need to fear the wrath of the world.
Influence Bonus: 2 Fear; +2 at T2
Calling: Canaan becomes Tier 3 (read Promised Land)
Bane: 9 fear on Canaan with 0 faith
Promised Land: Every time the player Joshua would become influencer of Canaan (even if the player already is) it goes up one tier
Special Rules:
Fear [X]: Reduce all other player's influence by [X] on this location
Faith: If you have 0 influence on this location, Use your faith as influence.  Faith is not affected by fear.

character.name: Jonah
character.quote: In my distress I called to the Lord, and he answered me.

location.name: Nineveh
info: Story: Initially he leaves for [Tarshish] in order to escape God's call, but God provides a [huge fish] to bring him back to his mission to the [foolish] and [wicked] people of Nineveh.  He eventually exhorts the city into repentence, but does not himself repent of his hardness until he has seen his [leafy plant] destroyed by a worm and [scorching east wind] and God explains how much more the people of Nineveh are worth and should be provided for

Theme: Jonah is given provision by God constantly.  Even in the throws of death, consumed by the sea, God provides for him.  Even in the darkest depravity of the human condition, God wishes to provide a way out (through repentence) to the Ninevites as well.
Influence Bonus: Provision 1
Calling: Play 4 Ninevites on Nineveh AND be influencer of Nineveh
Bane: Be Hardened 3 times (read Hardened heart)
Hardened Heart: If Jonah is played on any location besides Nineveh (by the player, or provision), add 1 hardened to Nineveh
Special Rules:
Provision [X]: This card draws and plays [X] cards on its location

character.name: Esther
character.quote: I will go to the king, even though it is against the law. And if I perish, I perish.

location.name: Babylon
info: Story: Esther is adopted by her uncle [Mordecai] who saves the kings life (which goes unnoticed for quite some time) and opposes a proud man [Haman] who looks to destroy her people through a [corrupt] bribe to the [king].  Numerous [King's servants] work with Esther to gain the favor of the very fickle [king], reveal Haman's treachery, and prevent the [annihilation] of God's people
Theme: Esther is a story of reaping what you sow.  Those who work with integrity and make good on their promises will be rewarded by God in heaven.
Calling: Play 14 influence more than any other player on Babylon
Bane: Have negative influence on Babylon
Influence Bonus: 1 Influence, Endeavor
Special Rules:
Endeavor: An endeavor is something someone does, and can do with either integrity... or not...  Depending on how well an undertaking is done, you will garner more influence
Integrity: Add up your total Integrity on a location and multiply it by the number of endeavors on the location.  Add that to your influence.
Mordecai: copy the card with the highest cost you have already played on this location-- character/starter card costs are 0
Xerxe's Vow: At the end of the turn, BEFORE the influence phase, permanently trade this card with the highest cost card on the location

paul.name: Exhortation
paul.quote: The peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus. (Philippians4:7)

paul.name: Epistle
paul.quote: It is no trouble for me to write the same things to you again, and it is a safeguard for you. (Philippians 3:1)

paul.name: Barnabas
paul.quote: Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught great numbers of people. The disciples were called Christians first at Antioch (Acts 11:26)

paul.name: Priscilla and Aquilla
paul.quote: The churches in the province of Asian send you greetings.  Aquila and Priscilla greet you warmly in the Lord (1Cor 16:19)

paul.name: Timothy
paul.quote: Timothy, my son whom I love, who is faithful in the Lord (1Cor 4:17)

paul.name: Mob Mentallity
paul.quote: They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, thinking he was dead. (Acts 14:19)

paul.name: Angelic Protection
paul.quote: An angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve stood beside me and said, ‘Do not be afraid (acts 27:23)

paul.name: Imprisonment
paul.quote: I stand on trial because of the hope of the resurrection of the dead (Acts 23:6)

paul.name: Stormy Seas
paul.quote: A wind of hurricane force, called the Northeaster, swept down from the island (Acts 27:14)

joshua.name: Milk and Honey
joshua.quote: A land flowing with milk and honey (Exodus 3:8)

joshua.name: Spies
joshua.quote: Let us send men ahead to spy out the land for us and bring back a report. (Deut 1:22)

joshua.name: Faithful Report
joshua.quote: It is a good land that the Lord our God is giving us.(Duet 1:25)

joshua.name: The Nephilim
joshua.quote: The land we explored devours those living in it. All the people we saw there are of great size. We saw the Nephilim there (Num 13:32-33)

joshua.name: NATSOTS
joshua.quote: A huge army, as numerous as the sand on the seashore. (Joshua 11:4)

joshua.name: Curses of Mt. Ebal
joshua.quote: choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve... But as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord. (Joshua 24)

joshua.name: Blessings of Mt. Gerezim
joshua.quote: You have declared this day that the Lord is your God and that you will walk in obedience to him, that you will keep his decrees, commands and laws—that you will listen to him

jonah.name: Ninevite Priestess
jonah.quote: People who cannot tell their right hand from their left

jonah.name: Ninevite Warrior
jonah.quote: Those who cling to worthless idols turn away from God’s love for them

jonah.name: Ship for Tarshish
jonah.quote: Let everyone call urgently on God... give up their evil ways and their violence

jonah.name: Scorching East Wind
jonah.quote: God provided a scorching east wind, and the sun blazed on Jonah’s head... He wanted to die

jonah.name: Healing vine
jonah.quote: The Lord God provided a leafy plant... to ease his discomfort

jonah.name: Huge fish
jonah.quote: Now the Lord provided a huge fish to swallow Jonah

esther.name: Taxes
esther.quote: Destroy them, and I will give ten thousand talents of silver to the king’s administrators

esther.name: Haman's Undertaking
esther.quote: Who is he? Where is he—the man who has dared to do such a thing?

esther.name: King's Servant
esther.quote: Relief and deliverance for these people will arise.

esther.name: Mordecai's Blessing
esther.quote: What should be done for the man the king delights to honor?

esther.name: Xerxes Command
esther.quote: What is your request? Even up to half the kingdom, it will be given you.
